intro: Croton carandaitensis, commonly known as the Carandaiti croton, is a species of flowering plant native to South America, specifically found in regions of Peru and Bolivia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap and distinctive floral structures. The plant is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves and vibrant, colorful inflorescences that attract pollinators. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
